title: Watch 6-foot-8 Steve Mowry add another submission win to his resume at Bellator 231
text:
UNCASVILLE, Conn. – Heavyweights are usually known for their knockouts, so it’s not entirely common you come across a 6-foot-8 heavyweight with the takedown and grappling skills of Steve Mowry.

Friday night at Bellator 231, Mowry (7-0 MMA, 3-0 BMMA) defeated Gegard Mousasi protege Gokhan Saricam (4-1 MMA, 0-1 BMMA) in the second round of their preliminary fight.

After he absorbed a few hard shots from the Netherlands native, Mowry decided to go back to his roots. Despite dragging the fight to the ground in Round 1, he wasn’t able to put away Saricam.

In Round 2, Mowry took his undefeated opponent to the ground again. This time, he saw the opening he was looking for and seized the moment. Mowry grabbed a hold of Saricam’s arm and cranked it behind his back. With the brutal torque on his shoulder and arm, it didn’t take long for Saricam to tap out.

The submission was Mowry’s fifth and it marked his seventh career finish.
